author: butta
content:
hi!
How does https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-6110 affect the validator activation queue?

> Decrease of delay between submitting deposit transaction on Execution Layer and its processing on Consensus Layer. That is, ~13 minutes with in-protocol deposit processing compared to ~12 hours with the existing mechanism.

Does this mean that the eth_follow_distance will be 0 instead of 2048? But voting validators in still takes place? If so, is there a limit how many validators can be voted in or will all validators receive an index immediately?

author: g11tech
content: as per our implementation, there are two kind of indices, finalized and unfinalized, so i guess the UI would ~~allocate~~ show an index on finalization

author: g11tech
content: (yes no follow distance, clients will have to make their of key => index map forkaware, though not really a big issue since unfinalized vals not gonna have any duties)

author: m.kalinin
content: The deposit transaction will be instantly processed by the CL upon inclusion into a block and a new validator record (if it is not a top-up) will be created. But after that the logic remains the same, so the new validator record will need to be finalized in the first place and after this happens the validator will be sent through the activation queue.
